answers.text: began to attract a more national pool of applicants

qas.question: What proportion of students at Washington University came from outside the St. Louis area by 1964?
When did Washington University transition to a national research institution?

answers.text: During the latter half of the 20th century,

qas.question: In what year did construction start on the "South 40"?
In what year was construction completed on the "South 40"?
What percentage of incoming students came from outside the St. Louis area in 1957?
In what type of housing did the commuter students live in?

context: <a4_0>During the latter half of the 20th century,<a4_0/> Washington University transitioned from a strong regional university to a national research institution. In <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>1957<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, planning began for the construction of the “<a1_0>South 40<a1_0/>,” a complex of modern residential halls. With the additional <b8_0>on-campus housing<b8_0/>, Washington University, which had been predominantly a “streetcar college” of commuter students, <a2_0>began to attract a more national pool of applicants<a2_0/>. By 1964, <a3_0><b7_0>over two-thirds<b7_0/><a3_0/> of incoming students came from outside the St. Louis area.
